1063.question: What is the performance change of the textual semantic similarity task when no error and maximum errors (noise) are present?
1063.response: {'Answer': 'When no error is present, the performance on the STS-B dataset is 0.89 for WordPiece, 0.69 for WhiteSpace, and 0.73 for N-gram(n=6). When the maximum amount of noise is present (20%), the performance drops to 0.35 for WordPiece, 0.22 for WhiteSpace, and 0.25 for N-gram(n=6).'}
1063.answer:
10 Epochs: pearson-Spearman correlation  drops  60 points when error increase by 20%
50 Epochs: pearson-Spearman correlation  drops  55 points when error increase by 20%

1064.question: Which sentiment analysis data set has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced?
1064.response: {'Answer': 'The SST-2 data set has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced.  The performance of the SST-2 data set drops from 0.82 to 0.73, while the performance of the STS-B data set drops from 0.89 to 0.6.  The difference in performance is greater for the SST-2 data set.'}
